on models.py

```
class ModelWithImage(models.Model):
    image = models.ImageField()
```

with `python manage.py shell`, run

```
from example.models import ModelWithImage
x = ModelWithImage(image='a' * 300)
x.save()
```

fields.how_to_reproduce:
on models.py

```
class ModelWithImage(models.Model):
    image = models.ImageField()
```

with `python manage.py shell`, run

```
from example.models import ModelWithImage
x = ModelWithImage(image='a' * 300)
x.save()
```

DataError2: value too long for type character varying(100)

fields.message:
Some library or yourself is trying to insert a value in a field that has `max_length=100` without a form or without cleaning the form, so the error is happening at db level. The field in question is probably a `FileField` or `ImageField` since their default `max_length` is 100 [1], which might not be enough for large paths.

The easiest solution is to increase field `max_length` to a value that is enough for your use case (ex: 255).

[1] [https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.6/ref/models/fields/#filefield](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.6/ref/models/fields/#filefield "https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.6/ref/models/fields/#filefield")

`to` parameter of [`EmailMessage`](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.7/topics/email/#the-emailmessage-class "EmailMessage") (or `send_mail`) should not be a list of lists, but only a list. **Change `to` to a list.**
